ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject.phase2

Class Odometer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject.phase2.Odometer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Odometer
extends java.lang.Thread
    The odometer class keeps track of the robot's (x, y, theta) position.
    Author:
    Rodrigo Silva, Dirk Dubois, Derek Yu, Karim El-Baba, Michael Smith, Younes Boubekeur

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

      Lets other threads know that a reset operation is over.

      Indicates if a thread is trying to reset any position parameters

      The current tacho count of the left motor.

      Fair lock for concurrent writing

      The odometer update period in ms.

      The tacho count of the left motor from the previous query.

      The tacho count of the right motor from the previous query.

      The current tacho count of the right motor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Odometer

        private Odometer()
        This is the default constructor of this class. It initiates all motors and variables once.It cannot be accessed externally.

    • Method Detail

      • getOdometer

        public static Odometer getOdometer()
        Returns the Odometer Object. Use this method to obtain an instance of Odometer.
        Returns:
        the Odometer Object

      • run

        public void run()
        This method is where the logic for the odometer will run.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • getXYT

        public double[] getXYT()
        Returns the Odometer data.

        Writes the current position and orientation of the robot onto the odoData array. odoData[0] = x, odoData[1] = y; odoData[2] = theta;

        Parameters:
        position - the array to store the odometer data
        Returns:
        the odometer data.

      • update

        public void update(double dx,
          double dy,
          double dtheta)
        Adds dx, dy and dtheta to the current values of x, y and theta, respectively. Useful for odometry.
        Parameters:
        dx -
        dy -
        dtheta -

      • setXYT

        public void setXYT(double x,
          double y,
          double theta)
        Overrides the values of x, y and theta. Use for odometry correction.
        Parameters:
        x - the value of x
        y - the value of y
        theta - the value of theta in degrees

      • setX

        public void setX(double x)
        Overwrites x. Use for odometry correction.
        Parameters:
        x - the value of x

      • setY

        public void setY(double y)
        Overwrites y. Use for odometry correction.
        Parameters:
        y - the value of y

      • setTheta

        public void setTheta(double theta)
        Overwrites theta. Use for odometry correction.
        Parameters:
        theta - the value of theta
